Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw plants that have water, showing them healthy and growing.
The student can draw the same type of plants without water, illustrating them wilted or not growing well.
The student can include details in the drawing that show differences between plants with and without water (e.g., color, size, leaf condition).
The student can use patterns from observations to show differences between plants in different conditions (with water vs. without water) in their drawings.
